metadata.Title: CVE-2016-1780 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
WebKit in Apple iOS before 9.3 does not prevent hidden web views from reading orientation and motion data, which allows remote attackers to obtain sensitive information about a device's physical environment via a crafted web site.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1780` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.10.9-1ubuntu1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.10.9-1ubuntu1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.10.9-1ubuntu1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.10.9-1ubuntu1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.10.9-1ubuntu1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37-gtk2 - 2.10.9-1ubuntu1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

advisory.DiscoveredBy: Maryam Mehrnezhad, Ehsan Toreini, Siamak F. Shahandashti and Feng Hao

notes.Note: jdstrand> webkit receives limited support. For details, see https://wiki.ubuntu.com/SecurityTeam/FAQ#webkit webkit in Ubuntu uses the JavaScriptCore (JSC) engine, not V8

criterions.comment: qtwebkit-opensource-src: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'no update available').
qtwebkit-source: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'no update available').
webkit2gtk package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.10.9-1ubuntu1').
webkitgtk: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'no update available').
